ingredients: Turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, salt
steps: Knead flour into a firm dough for puris.
Make curry with sauteed onion, tomato, spices, and mashed potatoes.
Roll puris and deep fry till puffed.
Serve with hot aloo curry.

ingredients: Mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves
steps: Roast rava and keep aside.
Heat oil, temper mustard, dal, curry leaves, and onions.
Add water and salt, bring to boil.
Slowly add rava, stirring continuously. Cook till thick.

ingredients: Chole masala, chili powder, turmeric, salt
2 cups maida, curd, baking soda (for bhature)
steps: Pressure cook chickpeas and prepare spicy chole masala curry.
Make dough for bhature with maida, curd, soda, rest for 2 hrs.
Roll and deep fry bhature till golden.
Serve with hot chole.
Soak green gram for 4-5 hours, grind with chili, ginger, cumin, and salt.
Pour batter on hot tawa, spread like dosa.

ingredients: Stew: Mixed vegetables, coconut milk, green chili, spices

steps: Make a batter with flour, besan, yogurt and ferment overnight.
Pipe batter into hot oil in circular shapes, fry till crisp.
Dip fried jalebis in warm sugar syrup for 1-2 minutes.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

For Besan: Gram flour, ghee, sugar

steps: Mix gram flour, semolina, salt, lemon juice and water to make a smooth batter.

Pour tempering over steamed dhokla, garnish with coriander and serve.

Add vegetable mix, cover, and cook on low heat till tender.
Serve hot with puris or rice.

ingredients: For litti: 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1/2 cup sattu (roasted gram flour), 2 tbsp mustard oil, spices
For chokha: 2 medium roasted eggplants, 2 boiled potatoes, 2 tomatoes, 2 green chilies, mustard oil, salt, coriander
steps: Make dough with wheat flour, roll small balls.
Prepare stuffing with sattu, mustard oil, chopped onions, green chilies, and spices.

Bake or roast littis till crisp.
For chokha, mash roasted eggplants, boiled potatoes, and tomatoes; mix with mustard oil, salt, chilies, and coriander.
Serve litti hot with chokha.

ingredients: Variety of small portions: dal, rice, roti, vegetable sabzi, pickles, chutneys, yogurt, sweet dish
steps: Prepare multiple dishes such as dal, vegetable curry, rice, roti, and sweets.
Serve all items together on a large plate (thali).
Enjoy a balanced meal with diverse flavors and textures.

ingredients: 1 cup raw papaya, peeled and chopped
1 tsp alkaline water (khar water) or baking soda
steps: Heat mustard oil, add mustard seeds and dried chilies.
Add chopped raw papaya, turmeric, salt and saute.
Add alkaline water and cook till papaya softens.
Garnish with coriander and serve with rice.

ingredients: 2 tbsp mustard oil or vegetable oil
steps: Heat oil, saute onions, ginger-garlic paste and green chilies.
Add turmeric and chili powder.
Add prawns and cook till they turn pink.
Pour coconut milk, simmer gently till prawns are cooked and curry thickens.
Garnish with coriander and serve with rice.

ingredients: For parotta: 2 cups all-purpose flour, oil, water, salt
For chicken curry: 500g chicken, 2 onions, 2 tomatoes, 2 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, coconut milk (optional), oil, salt
steps: Make soft dough for parotta, roll and layer with oil, fold and roll again.
Cook on hot griddle till golden and flaky.
For curry, saute onions and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes and spices, cook till oil separates.
Add chicken, salt, and cook till tender.
Add coconut milk and simmer.
Serve hot parotta with chicken curry.

ingredients: Rice, roti, dal, vegetable curry, salad, pickle, curd, sweet
steps: Prepare each dish separately.
Arrange on a plate with rice, roti, dal, sabzi, pickle, curd, and sweet.
Serve fresh and enjoy.
